content: Risk management workshop today. Learned some harsh lessons from my gambling days. Applying them to trading now.
Had a heart-to-heart with my brother. Family grounding me as I navigate this new chapter in my career.
Spent the last four days refining my algorithm's decision tree. It’s getting smarter, but there’s still a long way to go.
Set up a meeting with a peer from the trading community. Sharing ideas and insights, hoping to collaborate soon.
Progress on the mentorship front. My new mentor has me diving into the ethics of trading algorithms. Deep stuff.
Just wrapped up a multi-day project on market volatility. My algorithm now predicts swings with 10% more accuracy. Progress!
Took a break from coding to visit an old friend. We talked about life, markets, and the importance of balance.
The mentorship is paying off. I'm now applying advanced ML techniques to my strategy. It's a game-changer.
Algorithm crashed today. Annoying, but it highlighted a flaw in my risk management. Back to the drawing board.
Reconnected with family over dinner. Their support is the foundation I need as I build my career back up.
Looking back, the past two months have been a whirlwind. From losing my job to finding a mentor, I'm on my way back up. Here's to the next challenge.
